page.title: 18Oteley
page.content: Oteley, known in Saxon times as the clearing or field where oats grew, became well-known in later days for its lovely Elizabethan mansion and deer park. Later a stone-built mansion was lived in from 1838 untill 1960,when it was pulled down to make room for a more modern brick house,which the family moved into for Christmas 1962 and live in today. The lovely walled gardens with espaliered trees and enclosed vegetable gardens are still there, but the Deer Park no longer exists. There are many fir trees and rhododendrons in the park, which is occasionally open to the public. The farm at Oteley produces wheat and barley. Beef cattle are also reared and there is fine coarse fishing on the estate.
